terms.definition: A centralized system that organizes, stores, and facilitates access to an organization's collective information and expertise
Research and Development - the investigative activities that organizations conduct to improve existing products and procedures or to lead to the development of new products and procedures
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and see modification history
A chronological record of system activities that provides documentary evidence of the sequence of activities that have affected a specific operation or event
The ability for multiple users to work simultaneously on the same document or project with changes visible instantly to all participants
Laboratory Information Management System - software that manages samples, associated data, and laboratory workflow
Electronic Lab Notebook - a computer program designed to replace paper laboratory notebooks for recording research, experiments, and procedures
A security approach that restricts system access to authorized users based on their role within an organization
Intellectual Property - creations of the mind such as inventions, designs, and proprietary information that can be legally owned and protected
Food and Drug Administration - the U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating and supervising the safety of drugs, medical devices, and other consumer products
European Medicines Agency - the European Union's regulatory body for the evaluation and supervision of medicinal products
The practice of storing and managing all organizational data in a single, unified location or system for improved accessibility and consistency
Software features that automatically verify whether documents and processes meet required regulatory standards and guidelines
A software system designed to create, organize, manage, and publish various types of documents and content
The use of technology to automatically execute business processes and tasks without manual intervention, improving efficiency and reducing errors
